## Background
interior subspecies of northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis atricapillus) 

declined severely in the past few years in the Skeena Region ( Eamer, J. 2018. Action plan for recovery and conservation of interior northern goshawks in the Skeena Region: Background and framework. Prepared for Ministry of Forests, Lands, Natural
Resource Operations and Rural Development, Skeena Region. Smithers BC. )

### Provincial Status
In British Columbia, interiro northern goshawk are [*blue listed*](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/plants-animals-ecosystems/conservation-data-centre/explore-cdc-data/red-blue-yellow-lists), meaning they are at risk, but not extirpated, endangered or threatened. They have an [S3S$](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/plants-animals-ecosystems/conservation-data-centre/explore-cdc-data/status-ranks) conservation status, meaning they are siomehwer between apparently secure and vulnerable due to a restricted range, relatively few populations, recent and widespread declines, or other factors.
